description: Zeroless pandigital numbers: numbers containing the digits 1-9 and no 0's.
comments: The first 9!=362,880 terms of this sequence are permutations of the digits 1-9 with a(9!)=987654321. [From _Jeremy Gardiner_, May 28 2010]First differences are given in A209280 (for the first 9! terms) or in A219664 (for at least as much initial terms). [_M. F. Hasler_, Mar 03 2013]A230959(a(n)) = 0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 02 2013
links: James Grime and Brady Haran, Why 381,654,729 is awesome (2013)
H. Fripertinger, Operate on "9" to display zeroless pandigitals
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pandigital Number
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
